docs.title: PowerBI CLI
docs.text:
The Power BI command-line interface (Power BI CLI) is a set of commands used to create and manage Power BI resources (e.g. reports, users and capacity). The CLI is designed to get you working quickly with Power BI, with an emphasis on automation.

Credits

This is a portage version of the NodeJS version available here into a Python version for a personal project. Most of the documentation, package organization is inspired from this project.

docs.title: References
docs.text:
• https://github.com/andrewvillazon/pbipy
  • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/power-bi/
  • https://typer.tiangolo.com/
  • https://powerbi-cli.github.io/index.html
  • https://github.com/powerbi-cli/powerbi-cli

docs.title: powerbi
docs.text:
Base PowerBI CLI entrypoint

Usage:

powerbi [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: admin
docs.text:
Interact with PowerBI Admin panel

Usage:

powerbi admin [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: auth
docs.text:
Interact with PowerBI Auth

Usage:

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: token
docs.text:
Print the auth token

Usage:

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: dataset
docs.text:
Interact with PowerBI Dataset

Usage:

powerbi dataset [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: get
docs.text:
Get details about one Dataset in a given workspace

Usage:

powerbi dataset get [OPTIONS] DATASET

Options:

Name Type Description Default -w, --workspace text N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: list
docs.text:
List Dataset in given workspace

Usage:

powerbi dataset list [OPTIONS]

Options:

Name Type Description Default -w, --workspace text N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: query
docs.text:
Execute a DAX query against the Power BI XMLA endpoint

Usage:

powerbi dataset query [OPTIONS] QUERY

Options:

Name Type Description Default -w, --workspace text N/A None -d, --dataset text N/A _required --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: refresh
docs.text:
Interact with PowerBI Dataset Refresh

Usage:

powerbi dataset refresh [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: start
docs.text:
Triggers a refresh for the specified dataset from the specified workspace.

Usage:

powerbi dataset refresh start [OPTIONS] DATASET

Options:

Name Type Description Default -w, --workspace text N/A None --notify choice (MailOnCompletion | MailOnFailure | NoNotification) N/A None --type choice (Automatic | Calculate | ClearValues | DataOnly | Defragment | Full) N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: report
docs.text:
Interact with PowerBI Reports

Usage:

powerbi report [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: export
docs.text:
Download the report as .pbix or .rdl depending on the report

Usage:

powerbi report export [OPTIONS] REPORT

Options:

Name Type Description Default -w, --workspace text N/A None -o, --output path N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: get
docs.text:
Get details about one Dataset in a given workspace

Usage:

powerbi report get [OPTIONS] REPORT

Options:

Name Type Description Default -w, --workspace text N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: list
docs.text:
List Reports in given workspace

Usage:

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: open
docs.text:
Open a given report in the web browser

Usage:

Options:

Name Type Description Default -w, --workspace text N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: workspace
docs.text:
Interact with PowerBI Workspace

Usage:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: get
docs.text:
Get details about one Dataset in a given workspace

Usage:

Options:

Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: list

Options:

Name Type Description Default --top integer N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False

docs.title: Pre-requisites
docs.text: The Power BI CLI can use the autorisation flow of Azure CLI. To install the Azure CLI see the documentation: Install the Azure CLI

docs.title: Install
docs.text:
Use pipx to setup a standalone install:

❯ pipx install powerbi-cli

docs.title: Authentification
docs.text:
The authentification is made through the azure.identity package and the DefaultAzureCredential method.

By order, it will look for the following authentification method:

  1. Azure Credentials
  2. Visual Code Studio
  3. Azure CLI
  4. Webbrowser identification

docs.title: Samples for datasets
docs.text: Command Description list List datasets from a given workspace query Execute a DAX query on a given dataset from a given workspace

docs.title: List datasets
docs.text:
List datasets the user/service principal has access to for a certain workspace

$ pbi dataset list --workspace {WORKSPACE_ID}

DATASET ID     NAME               CONFIGURED BY      CREATED DATE
-------------  -----------------  -----------------  ------------------------
DATASET_ID_1   DATASET_NAME_1     xxx@mycompany.com  2022-05-09T08:01:09.517Z
DATASET_ID_2   DATASET_NAME_2     yyy@mycompany.com  2022-08-18T09:04:16.867Z

docs.title: Execute query
docs.text:
Executes a DAX query to a premium dataset

$ pbi dataset query "EVALUATE ROW(\"distinct\", DISTINCTCOUNT('MyTable'[MyColumn]))"

2023-10-25 18:43:47 [info     ] EVALUATE ROW("distinct", DISTINCTCOUNT('MyTable'[MyColumn])) dataset=<Dataset id='DATASET_ID', name='DATASET_NAME', group_id='WORKSPACE_ID', configured_by='xxx@mycompany.com', created_date='2023-10-12T09:51:56.407Z'>
Duration: 0.1640009580005426
{'results': [{'tables': [{'rows': [{'[distinct]': 3602}]}]}]}
